dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: py-tomli
dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: py-nose
dependencies.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-hypothesis
dependencies.description: A library for property based testing.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependent_to.name: lvarray
dependent_to.description: LvArray portable HPC containers.

dependent_to.name: py-gimmik
dependent_to.description:
Generator of Matrix Multiplication Kernels - GiMMiK - is a tool for
generation of high performance matrix multiplication kernel code. for
various accelerator platforms.

dependent_to.name: heasoft
dependent_to.description:
A Unified Release of the FTOOLS and XANADU Software Packages. XANADU:
High-level, multi-mission tasks for X-ray astronomical spectral, timing,
and imaging data analysis. FTOOLS: General and mission-specific tools to
manipulate FITS files. FITSIO: Core library responsible for reading and
writing FITS files. fv: General FITS file browser/editor/plotter with a
graphical user interface. XSTAR: Tool for calculating the physical
conditions and emission spectra of photoionized gases

dependent_to.name: py-seaborn
dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependent_to.name: py-chemfiles
dependent_to.description: Python interface to chemfiles

dependent_to.name: py-scine-puffin
dependent_to.description: Calculation handler for SCINE Chemoton

dependent_to.name: py-xtb
dependent_to.description: Python API for the extended tight binding program package

dependent_to.name: py-pynio
dependent_to.description:
PyNIO ("pie-nee-oh") is a Python module that allows read and/or write
access to a variety of scientific data formats popular in climate and
weather

dependent_to.name: py-mapbox-earcut
dependent_to.description:
Python bindings for the C++ implementation of the Mapbox Earcut library,
which provides very fast and quite robust triangulation of 2D polygons.

dependent_to.name: spiner
dependent_to.description:
Spiner: Performance portable routines for generic, tabulated, multi-
dimensional data

dependent_to.name: py-arviz
dependent_to.description:
ArviZ (pronounced "AR-vees") is a Python package for exploratory
analysis of Bayesian models. Includes functions for posterior analysis,
model checking, comparison and diagnostics.

dependent_to.name: py-equation
dependent_to.description: General Equation Parser and Evaluator

dependent_to.name: py-kmodes
dependent_to.description:
Python implementations of the k-modes and k-prototypes clustering
algorithms for clustering categorical data.

dependent_to.name: py-timm
dependent_to.description: (Unofficial) PyTorch Image Models.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: py-theano
dependent_to.description:
Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and
GPUs.

dependent_to.name: py-statsmodels
dependent_to.description: Statistical computations and models for use with SciPy

dependent_to.name: spectre
dependent_to.description:
The SpECTRE numerical relativity code. SpECTRE is an open-source code
for multi-scale, multi-physics problems in astrophysics and
gravitational physics. In the future, we hope that it can be applied to
problems across discipline boundaries in fluid dynamics, geoscience,
plasma physics, nuclear physics, and engineering. It runs at petascale
and is designed for future exascale computers. SpECTRE is being
developed in support of our collaborative Simulating eXtreme Spacetimes
(SXS) research program into the multi-messenger astrophysics of neutron
star mergers, core-collapse supernovae, and gamma-ray bursts.

dependent_to.name: py-pylatex
dependent_to.description: A Python library for creating LaTeX files and snippets

dependent_to.name: py-spectral
dependent_to.description:
Spectral Python (SPy) is a pure Python module for processing
hyperspectral image data (imaging spectroscopy data). It has functions
for reading, displaying, manipulating, and classifying hyperspectral
imagery. SPy is Free, Open Source Software (FOSS) distributed under the
MIT License.

dependent_to.name: py-torchsummary
dependent_to.description:
Keras has a neat API to view the visualization of the model which is
very helpful while debugging your network. Here is a barebone code to
try and mimic the same in PyTorch. The aim is to provide information
complementary to, what is not provided by print(your_model) in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-seqeval
dependent_to.description:
seqeval is a Python framework for sequence labeling evaluation. seqeval
can evaluate the performance of chunking tasks such as named-entity
recognition, part-of-speech tagging, semantic role labeling and so on.

dependent_to.name: py-picmistandard
dependent_to.description: Standard input format for Particle-In-Cell codes

dependent_to.name: py-pydap
dependent_to.description: An implementation of the Data Access Protocol.

dependent_to.name: py-ucx-py
dependent_to.description:
UCX-Py is the Python interface for UCX, a low-level high-performance
networking library. UCX and UCX-Py supports several transport methods
including InfiniBand and NVLink while still using traditional networking
protocols like TCP.

dependent_to.name: py-imbalanced-learn
dependent_to.description:
imbalanced-learn is a python package offering a number of re-sampling
techniques commonly used in datasets showing strong between-class
imbalance. It is compatible with scikit-learn and is part of scikit-
learn-contrib projects.

dependent_to.name: py-ipyrad
dependent_to.description:
An interactive toolkit for assembly and analysis of restriction-site
associated genomic data sets (e.g., RAD, ddRAD, GBS) for population
genetic and phylogenetic studies.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-matminer
dependent_to.description:
Matminer is a library for performing data mining in the field of
materials science.

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: py-mapclassify
dependent_to.description: Classification Schemes for Choropleth Maps.

dependent_to.name: py-lazyarray
dependent_to.description:
a Python package that provides a lazily-evaluated numerical array class,
larray, based on and compatible with NumPy arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorly
dependent_to.description:
TensorLy is a Python library that aims at making tensor learning simple
and accessible. It allows to easily perform tensor decomposition, tensor
learning and tensor algebra. Its backend system allows to seamlessly
perform computation with NumPy, PyTorch, JAX, MXNet, TensorFlow or CuPy,
and run methods at scale on CPU or GPU.

dependent_to.name: mapl
dependent_to.description:
MAPL is a foundation layer of the GEOS architecture, whose original
purpose is to supplement the Earth System Modeling Framework (ESMF).
MAPL fills in missing capabilities of ESMF, provides higher-level
interfaces for common boiler-plate logic, and enforces various
componentization conventions across ESMF gridded components within GEOS.

dependent_to.name: py-fitter
dependent_to.description:
fitter package provides a simple class to identify the distribution from
which a data samples is generated from. It uses 80 distributions from
Scipy and allows you to plot the results to check what is the most
probable distribution and the best parameters.

dependent_to.name: py-opppy
dependent_to.description:
The Output Parse-Plot Python (OPPPY) library is a python based data
analysis library designed to extract, store, and plot information from
output and dump files generated by scientific software packages.

dependent_to.name: faiss
dependent_to.description:
Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of
dense vectors. Faiss contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors
of any size, up to ones that possibly do not fit in RAM. It also
contains supporting code for evaluation and parameter tuning. Faiss is
written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy. Some of the most
useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed by
Facebook AI Research.

dependent_to.name: py-dh-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
A Modified version of scikit-optimize a Sequential model-based
optimization toolbox for DeepHyper. Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a
simple and efficient library to minimize (very) expensive and noisy
black-box functions. It implements several methods for sequential model-
based optimization. skopt aims to be accessible and easy to use in many
contexts. The library is built on top of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-cfgrib
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to map GRIB files to the NetCDF Common Data Model
following the CF Convention using ecCodes.

dependent_to.name: py-pyhull
dependent_to.description:
Pyhull is a Python wrapper to Qhull (http://www.qhull.org/) for the
computation of the convex hull, Delaunay triangulation and Voronoi
diagram. It is written as a Python C extension, with both high-level and
low-level interfaces to qhull.

dependent_to.name: bufr
dependent_to.description:
The NOAA bufr library contains subroutines, functions and other
utilities that can be used to read (decode) and write (encode) data in
BUFR, which is a WMO standard format for the exchange of meteorological
data. This is part of the NCEPLIBS project. The library also includes a
Python interface.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatreader
dependent_to.description: Convenient reader for Matlab mat files.

dependent_to.name: uqtk
dependent_to.description:
Sandia Uncertainty Quantification Toolkit. The UQ Toolkit (UQTk) is a
collection of libraries and tools for the quantification of uncertainty
in numerical model predictions

dependent_to.name: py-datasets
dependent_to.description:
Datasets is a lightweight library providing two main features: one-line
dataloaders for many public datasets and efficient data pre-processing.

dependent_to.name: py-histoprint
dependent_to.description: Pretty print of NumPy (and other) histograms to the console

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-pybedtools
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper -- and more -- for Aaron Quinlan's BEDTools

dependent_to.name: py-resampy
dependent_to.description: Efficient sample rate conversion in python

dependent_to.name: py-ultralytics
dependent_to.description:
Ultralytics YOLOv8, developed by Ultralytics, is a cutting-edge, state-
of-the-art (SOTA) model that builds upon the success of previous YOLO
versions and introduces new features and improvements to further boost
performance and flexibility. YOLOv8 is designed to be fast, accurate,
and easy to use, making it an excellent choice for a wide range of
object detection, image segmentation and image classification tasks.

dependent_to.name: py-hmmlearn
dependent_to.description:
hmmlearn is a set of algorithms for unsupervised learning and inference
of Hidden Markov Models.

dependent_to.name: py-networkit
dependent_to.description:
NetworKit is a growing open-source toolkit for large-scale network
analysis. Its aim is to provide tools for the analysis of large networks
in the size range from thousands to billions of edges. For this purpose,
it implements efficient graph algorithms, many of them parallel to
utilize multicore architectures. These are meant to compute standard
measures of network analysis, such as degree sequences, clustering
coefficients, and centrality measures. In this respect, NetworKit is
comparable to packages such as NetworkX, albeit with a focus on
parallelism and scalability.

dependent_to.name: roary
dependent_to.description: Rapid large-scale prokaryote pan genome analysis

dependent_to.name: topaz
dependent_to.description:
topaz: Pipeline for particle picking in cryo-electron microscopy images
using convolutional neural networks trained from positive and unlabeled
examples. Also featuring micrograph and tomogram denoising with DNNs.

dependent_to.name: py-sdv
dependent_to.description:
The Synthetic Data Vault (SDV) is a Synthetic Data Generation ecosystem
of libraries that allows users to easily learn single-table, multi-table
and timeseries datasets to later on generate new Synthetic Data that has
the same format and statistical properties as the original dataset.

dependent_to.name: vigra
dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: py-traitsui
dependent_to.description:
The TraitsUI project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction
layer, which is used to support the "visualization" features of the
Traits package. Thus, you can write model in terms of the Traits API and
specify a GUI in terms of the primitives supplied by TraitsUI (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let TraitsUI and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.

dependent_to.name: py-imageio
dependent_to.description:
Python library for reading and writing image data. Imageio is a Python
library that provides an easy interface to read and write a wide range
of image data, including animated images, video, volumetric data, and
scientific formats. It is cross-platform, runs on Python 2.7 and 3.4+,
and is easy to install.

dependent_to.name: py-transforms3d
dependent_to.description: Functions for 3D coordinate transformations.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorboard
dependent_to.description:
TensorBoard is a suite of web applications for inspecting and
understanding your TensorFlow runs and graphs.

dependent_to.name: steps
dependent_to.description: STochastic Engine for Pathway Simulation

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-dijitso
dependent_to.description: A Python module for distributed just-in-time shared library building

dependent_to.name: py-astropy-healpix
dependent_to.description:
HEALPix (Hierarchical Equal Area isoLatitude Pixelisation) is an
algorithm for pixellizing a sphere that is sometimes used in Astronomy
to store data from all-sky surveys, but the general algorithm can apply
to any field that has to deal with representing data on a sphere.

dependent_to.name: py-pyopencl
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for OpenCL.

dependent_to.name: sz
dependent_to.description: Error-bounded Lossy Compressor for HPC Data

dependent_to.name: py-ctgan
dependent_to.description:
CTGAN is a collection of Deep Learning based Synthetic Data Generators
for single table data, which are able to learn from real data and
generate synthetic clones with high fidelity.

dependent_to.name: py-scipy
dependent_to.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyts
dependent_to.description:
pyts is a Python package for time series classification. It aims to make
time series classification easily accessible by providing preprocessing
and utility tools, and implementations of state-of-the-art algorithms.
Most of these algorithms transform time series, thus pyts provides
several tools to perform these transformations.

dependent_to.name: py-cclib
dependent_to.description:
Open source library for parsing and interpreting the results of
computational chemistry packages

dependent_to.name: py-pysolar
dependent_to.description:
Pysolar is a collection of Python libraries for simulating the
irradiation of any point on earth by the sun. It includes code for
extremely precise ephemeris calculations, and more.

dependent_to.name: halide
dependent_to.description:
Halide is a programming language designed to make it easier to write
high-performance image and array processing code on modern machines.

dependent_to.name: hicops
dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.

dependent_to.name: py-bitshuffle
dependent_to.description: Filter for improving compression of typed binary data.

dependent_to.name: py-scs
dependent_to.description: SCS: splitting conic solver

dependent_to.name: py-msgpack-numpy
dependent_to.description:
This package provides encoding and decoding routines that enable the
serialization and deserialization of numerical and array data types
provided by numpy using the highly efficient msgpack format.
Serialization of Python's native complex data types is also supported.

dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark
dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.

dependent_to.name: py-thewalrus
dependent_to.description:
A library for the calculation of hafnians, Hermite polynomials and
Gaussian boson sampling.

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: mlpack
dependent_to.description:
mlpack is an intuitive, fast, and flexible header-only C++ machine
learning library with bindings to other languages. It is meant to be a
machine learning analog to LAPACK, and aims to implement a wide array of
machine learning methods and functions as a "swiss army knife" for
machine learning researchers.

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-rseqc
dependent_to.description:
RSeQC package provides a number of useful modules that can
comprehensively evaluate high throughput sequence data especially RNA-
seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-pyabel
dependent_to.description: A Python package for forward and inverse Abel transforms.

dependent_to.name: py-pennylane
dependent_to.description: PennyLane is a Python quantum machine learning library by Xanadu Inc.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-fuzzy
dependent_to.description: Fuzzy logic toolkit for SciPy

dependent_to.name: berkeleygw
dependent_to.description:
BerkeleyGW is a many-body perturbation theory code for excited states,
using the GW method and the GW plus Bethe-Salpeter equation (GW-BSE)
method to solve respectively for quasiparticle excitations and optical
properties of materials.

dependent_to.name: py-pdbfixer
dependent_to.description:
PDBFixer is an easy to use application for fixing problems in Protein
Data Bank files in preparation for simulating them.

dependent_to.name: isescan
dependent_to.description:
A python pipeline to identify IS (Insertion Sequence) elements in genome
and metagenome

dependent_to.name: py-basemap
dependent_to.description:
The matplotlib basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps
in Python.

dependent_to.name: salome-medcoupling
dependent_to.description:
salome-medcoupling is a part of SALOME platform to manipulate meshes and
fields in memory, and use salome-med format for files.

dependent_to.name: py-pot
dependent_to.description:
This open source Python library provide several solvers for
optimization problems related to Optimal Transport for signal, image
processing and machine learning.

dependent_to.name: py-morph-tool
dependent_to.description: Python morphology manipulation toolkit

dependent_to.name: py-torch-geometric
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch Geometric (PyG) is a geometric deep learning extension library
for PyTorch. It consists of various methods for deep learning on graphs
and other irregular structures, also known as geometric deep learning,
from a variety of published papers. In addition, it consists of an easy-
to-use mini-batch loader for many small and single giant graphs, multi
gpu-support, a large number of common benchmark datasets (based on
simple interfaces to create your own), and helpful transforms, both for
learning on arbitrary graphs as well as on 3D meshes or point clouds.

dependent_to.name: py-stratify
dependent_to.description:
Vectorized interpolators that are especially useful for Nd vertical
interpolation/stratification of atmospheric and oceanographic datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-cmyt
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib colormaps from the yt project !

dependent_to.name: py-cuml
dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.

dependent_to.name: py-moviepy
dependent_to.description:
MoviePy is a Python module for video editing, which can be used for
basic operations (like cuts, concatenations, title insertions), video
compositing (a.k.a. non-linear editing), video processing, or to create
advanced effects. It can read and write the most common video formats,
including GIF.

dependent_to.name: py-neurora
dependent_to.description: A Python Toolbox for Multimodal Neural Data Representation Analysis.

dependent_to.name: root
dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.

dependent_to.name: py-xanadu-cloud-client
dependent_to.description:
The Xanadu Cloud Client (XCC) is a Python API and CLI for the Xanadu
Cloud.

dependent_to.name: py-fairscale
dependent_to.description:
FairScale is a PyTorch extension library for high performance and large
scale training. This library extends basic PyTorch capabilities while
adding new SOTA scaling techniques.

dependent_to.name: py-bidskit
dependent_to.description: Tools for DICOM to BIDS conversion.

dependent_to.name: py-pycuda
dependent_to.description:
PyCUDA gives you easy, Pythonic access to Nvidia's CUDA parallel
computation API

dependent_to.name: truchas
dependent_to.description:
Physics-based modeling and simulation of manufacturing processes.
Truchas includes coupled physics models for incompressible multi-
material flow with interface tracking, heat transfer, phase change, view
factor thermal radiation, species advection-diffusion, elastic/plastic
mechanics with contact, and electromagnetics. It employs finite volume,
finite element, and mimetic finite difference discretizations on 3-D
unstructured meshes composed of mixed cell types.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-ffcx
dependent_to.description: Next generation FEniCS Form Compiler

dependent_to.name: py-onnx
dependent_to.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers
AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX
provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and
traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as
well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types.
Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).

dependent_to.name: py-jax
dependent_to.description:
JAX is Autograd and XLA, brought together for high-performance machine
learning research. With its updated version of Autograd, JAX can
automatically differentiate native Python and NumPy functions. It can
differentiate through loops, branches, recursion, and closures, and it
can take derivatives of derivatives of derivatives. It supports reverse-
mode differentiation (a.k.a. backpropagation) via grad as well as
forward-mode differentiation, and the two can be composed arbitrarily to
any order.

dependent_to.name: py-snuggs
dependent_to.description: Snuggs are s-expressions for Numpy

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a simple and efficient library to minimize
(very) expensive and noisy black-box functions. It implements several
methods for sequential model-based optimization. skopt aims to be
accessible and easy to use in many contexts. The library is built on top
of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-lineenhancer
dependent_to.description: The line enhancer is only used by crYOLO internally

dependent_to.name: py-minkowskiengine
dependent_to.description:
The MinkowskiEngine is an auto-differentiation library for sparse
tensors.

dependent_to.name: mrtrix3
dependent_to.description:
MRtrix provides a set of tools to perform various advanced diffusion MRI
analyses, including constrained spherical deconvolution (CSD),
probabilistic tractography, track-density imaging, and apparent fibre
density.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: redundans
dependent_to.description: Redundans pipeline assists an assembly of heterozygous genomes.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-aer
dependent_to.description:
Aer is a high performance simulator for quantum circuits that includes
noise models

dependent_to.name: py-modred
dependent_to.description:
Modred is a parallelized library for finding modal decompositions and
reduced-order models.

dependent_to.name: py-mizani
dependent_to.description:
Mizani is a scales package for graphics. It is based on Hadley Wickham's
Scales package.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-ffc
dependent_to.description:
The FEniCS Form Compiler FFC is a compiler for finite element
variational forms, translating high-level mathematical descriptions of
variational forms into efficient low-level C++ code for finite element
assembly.

dependent_to.name: libcint
dependent_to.description: Library for analytical Gaussian integrals for quantum chemistry.

dependent_to.name: py-parasail
dependent_to.description:
Python Bindings for the Parasail C Library. Parasail is a SIMD C (C99)
library containing implementations of the Smith-Waterman (local),
Needleman-Wunsch (global), and semi-global pairwise sequence alignment
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-bluepyopt
dependent_to.description: Bluebrain Python Optimisation Library

dependent_to.name: sgpp
dependent_to.description:
SGpp is a library and framework for sparse grids in different flavors.
SGpp supports both hierarchical spatially-adaptive sparse grids and the
dimensionally-adaptive sparse grid combination technique.

dependent_to.name: py-keras2onnx
dependent_to.description: Converts Machine Learning models to ONNX for use in Windows ML

dependent_to.name: py-dxchange

dependent_to.name: legion
dependent_to.description:
Legion is a data-centric parallel programming system for writing
portable high performance programs targeted at distributed heterogeneous
architectures. Legion presents abstractions which allow programmers to
describe properties of program data (e.g. independence, locality). By
making the Legion programming system aware of the structure of program
data, it can automate many of the tedious tasks programmers currently
face, including correctly extracting task- and data-level parallelism
and moving data around complex memory hierarchies. A novel mapping
interface provides explicit programmer controlled placement of data in
the memory hierarchy and assignment of tasks to processors in a way that
is orthogonal to correctness, thereby enabling easy porting and tuning
of Legion applications to new architectures.

dependent_to.name: tfel
dependent_to.description:
The TFEL project is a collaborative development of CEA (French
Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission) and EDF (Electricite
de France). It mostly contains the MFront code generator which
translates a set of closely related domain specific languages into plain
C++ on top of the TFEL libraries. MFront handles material properties,
mechanical behaviours and simple point-wise models. Interfaces are
provided for several finite element solvers, such as: Abaqus/Standard,
Abaqus/Explicit, Ansys APDL, Cast3M, Europlexus, Code_Aster, CalculiX
and a few others. MFront comes with an handy easy-to-use tool called
MTest that can test the local behaviour of a material, by imposing
independent constraints on each component of the strain or the stress.

dependent_to.description:
Devito is a Python package to implement optimized stencil computation.
(e.g., finite differences, image processing, machine learning) from
high-level symbolic problem definitions. Devito builds on SymPy and
employs automated code generation and just-in-time compilation to
execute optimized computational kernels on several computer platforms,
including CPUs, GPUs, and clusters thereof.

dependent_to.name: py-onnxconverter-common
dependent_to.description: ONNX Converter and Optimization Tools

dependent_to.name: py-pyface
dependent_to.description:
The pyface project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction layer,
which is used to support the "visualization" features of the Traits
package. Thus, you can write code in terms of the Traits API (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let pyface and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.

dependent_to.name: sensei
dependent_to.description:
SENSEI is a platform for scalable in-situ analysis and visualization.
Its design motto is "Write once, run everywhere", this means that once
the application is instrumented with SENSEI it can use existing and
future analysis backends. Existing backends include: Paraview/Catalyst,
Visit/Libsim, ADIOS, Python scripts, and so on.

dependent_to.name: phist
dependent_to.description:
The Pipelined, Hybrid-parallel Iterative Solver Toolkit provides
implementations of and interfaces to block iterative solvers for sparse
linear and eigenvalue problems. In contrast to other libraries we
support multiple backends (e.g. Trilinos, PETSc and our own optimized
kernels), and interfaces in multiple languages such as C, C++, Fortran
2003 and Python. PHIST has a clear focus on portability and hardware
performance: in particular support row-major storage of block vectors
and using GPUs (via the ghost library or Trilinos/Tpetra).

dependent_to.name: py-geocube
dependent_to.description: Tool to convert geopandas vector data into rasterized xarray data.

dependent_to.name: py-formulaic
dependent_to.description:
Formulaic is a high-performance implementation of Wilkinson formulas for
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-azureml-dataset-runtime
dependent_to.description:
The purpose of this package is to coordinate dependencies within AzureML
packages. It is not intended for public use.

dependent_to.name: py-pyvista
dependent_to.description: Easier Pythonic interface to VTK.

dependent_to.name: tiramisu
dependent_to.description:
Tiramisu is a polyhedral compiler for dense and sparse deep learning and
data parallel algorithms.It provides a simple C++ API for expressing
algorithms and how these algorithms should be optimized by the compiler.

dependent_to.name: py-mayavi
dependent_to.description: Mayavi: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyerfa
dependent_to.description:
PyERFA is the Python wrapper for the ERFA library (Essential Routines
for Fundamental Astronomy), a C library containing key algorithms for
astronomy, which is based on the SOFA library published by the
International Astronomical Union (IAU). All C routines are wrapped as
Numpy universal functions, so that they can be called with scalar or
array inputs.

dependent_to.name: serialbox
dependent_to.description:
Serialbox is a serialization library and tools for C/C++, Python3 and
Fortran. Serialbox is used in several projects for building validation
frameworks against reference runs.

dependent_to.name: opencv
dependent_to.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer
vision and machine learning software library.

dependent_to.name: py-statmorph
dependent_to.description:
Python code for calculating non-parametric morphological diagnostics of
galaxy images.

dependent_to.name: py-spherical
dependent_to.description:
Evaluate and transform D matrices, 3-j symbols, and (scalar or spin-
weighted) spherical harmonics

dependent_to.name: py-arm-pyart
dependent_to.description:
Python ARM Radar Toolkit. A growing collection of weather radar
algorithms and utilities build on top of the Scientific Python stack and
distributed under the 3-Clause BSD license. Py-ART is used by the
Atmospheric Radiation Measurement (ARM) Climate Research Facility for
working with data from a number of precipitation and cloud radars, but
has been designed so that it can be used by others in the radar and
atmospheric communities to examine, processes, and analyse data from
many types of weather radars.

dependent_to.name: py-robocrys
dependent_to.description:
Robocrystallographer is a tool to generate text descriptions of crystal
structures. Similar to how a real-life crystallographer would analyse a
structure, robocrystallographer looks at the symmetry, local
environment, and extended connectivity when generating a description.
The package includes utilities for identifying molecule names, component
orientations, heterostructure information, and more.

dependent_to.name: py-dm-haiku
dependent_to.description: JAX-based neural network library

dependent_to.name: py-biopandas

rasterstats is a Python module for summarizing geospatial raster
datasets based on vector geometries. It includes functions for zonal
statistics and interpolated point queries. The command-line interface
allows for easy interperability with other GeoJSON tools.

dependent_to.name: py-strawberryfields

dependent_to.name: py-contourpy

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem
dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-pyquaternion
dependent_to.description: Python morphology manipulation toolkit

dependent_to.name: bart

dependent_to.name: py-lightly-utils
dependent_to.description: A utility package for lightly.

dependent_to.name: py-gpyopt
dependent_to.description:
Performs global optimization with different acquisition functions. Among
other functionalities, it is possible to use GPyOpt to optimize physical
experiments (sequentially or in batches) and tune the parameters of
Machine Learning algorithms. It is able to handle large data sets via
sparse Gaussian process models.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-terra
dependent_to.description:
Qiskit is an open-source SDK for working with quantum computers at the
level of extended quantum circuits, operators, and algorithms.

dependent_to.name: boost
dependent_to.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

docking program that can be used to dock small molecules against
proteins and nucleic acids. The original version is found at the
following URL:
https://sourceforge.net/projects/rdock/files/rDock_2013.1_src.tar.gz

dependent_to.name: py-netpyne

Netpyne: A python package to facilitate the development, parallel
simulation, optimization and analysis of multiscale biological neuronal
networks in NEURON.

dependent_to.name: py-cython-bbox
dependent_to.description:
cython_bbox is widely used in object detection tasks. To my best
knowledge, it was first implemented in Faster-RCNN. Since then, almost
all object detection projects use the source code directly. In order to
use it in standalone code snippets or small projects, I make it a pypi
module. The cython_bbox.pyx is totally borrowed from Faster-RCNN. Thanks
RBG!

dependent_to.name: py-jpype1

Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) is a dimension

t-SNE, but also for general non-linear dimension reduction.

Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster data. Geographic information
systems use GeoTIFF and other formats to organize and store gridded, or
raster, datasets. Rasterio reads and writes these formats and provides a
Python API based on N-D arrays.

Unified interface to convex Quadratic Programming (QP) solvers available

The h5py package provides both a high- and low-level interface to the
HDF5 library from Python.

dependent_to.name: memsurfer

MemSurfer is a tool to compute and analyze membrane surfaces found in a
wide variety of large-scale molecular simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-nibabel
dependent_to.description: Access a multitude of neuroimaging data formats

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-instant
dependent_to.description:
Instant is a Python module that allows for instant inlining of C and C++
code in Python. It is a small Python module built on top of SWIG and
Distutils. Instant has been retired after 2017.2.0 release. It is no
longer needed in FEniCS and hence no longer maintained and tested.

dependent_to.name: py-medaka
dependent_to.description:
medaka is a tool to create consensus sequences and variant calls from
nanopore sequencing data. This task is performed using neural networks
applied a pileup of individual sequencing reads against a draft
assembly. It provides state-of-the-art results outperforming sequence-
graph based methods and signal-based methods, whilst also being faster.

dependent_to.name: py-lightgbm
dependent_to.description:
LightGBM is a gradient boosting framework that uses tree based learning
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-datacube
dependent_to.description: An analysis environment for satellite and other earth observation data.

dependent_to.name: py-bcolz
dependent_to.description:
bcolz provides columnar and compressed data containers. Column storage
allows for efficiently querying tables with a large number of columns.
It also allows for cheap addition and removal of column. In addition,
bcolz objects are compressed by default for reducing memory/disk I/O
needs. The compression process is carried out internally by Blosc, a
high-performance compressor that is optimized for binary data.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-torchfile

Mostly direct port of the torch7 Lua and C serialization implementation
to Python, depending only on numpy (and the standard library: array and
struct). Sharing of objects including torch.Tensors is preserved.

dependent_to.name: py-faststructure

dependent_to.name: octopus

A real-space finite-difference (time-dependent) density-functional

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-ufl
dependent_to.description:
The Unified Form Language (UFL) is a domain specific language for
declaration of finite element discretizations of variational forms. More
precisely, it defines a flexible interface for choosing finite element
spaces and defining expressions for weak forms in a notation close to
mathematical notation.

dependent_to.name: py-goatools
dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms

dependent_to.name: py-warpx
dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid OpenMP/MPI parallelization, advanced
vectorization techniques and load balancing capabilities. These are the
Python bindings of WarpX with PICMI input support. See the C++ 'warpx'
package for the WarpX application and library.

dependent_to.name: py-kb-python
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper around kallisto | bustools for scRNA-seq analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-pyamg

PyAMG is a library of Algebraic Multigrid (AMG) solvers with a
convenient Python interface.

dependent_to.name: py-geomdl
dependent_to.description: Object-oriented pure Python B-Spline and NURBS library.

dependent_to.name: py-symfit

dependent_to.name: py-deephyper

Scalable asynchronous neural architecture and hyperparameter search for
deep neural networks.

dependent_to.name: py-torchvision
dependent_to.description: Image and video datasets and models for torch deep learning.

dependent_to.name: py-asdf
dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Scientific Data Format (ASDF) is a next-generation
interchange format for scientific data. This package contains the Python
implementation of the ASDF Standard.

dependent_to.name: py-streamlit

dependent_to.name: py-reproject
dependent_to.description:
The reproject package is a Python package to reproject astronomical
images using various techniques via a uniform interface. By
reprojection, we mean the re-gridding of images from one world
coordinate system to another (for example changing the pixel resolution,
orientation, coordinate system). Currently, we have implemented
reprojection of celestial images by interpolation (like SWARP), as well
as by finding the exact overlap between pixels on the celestial sphere
(like Montage). It can also reproject to/from HEALPIX projections by
relying on the astropy-healpix package.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: py-numcodecs
dependent_to.description:
Numcodecs is a Python package providing buffer compression and
transformation codecs for use in data storage and communication
applications.

dependent_to.name: py-hep-ml
dependent_to.description: Machine Learning for High Energy Physics

dependent_to.name: py-uvw
dependent_to.description:

in Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: cp2k

that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid,
molecular, periodic, material, crystal, and biological systems

dependent_to.name: py-glmnet
dependent_to.description:

glmnet.

Units of measure as required by the Climate and Forecast (CF) metadata

Psi4 is an open-source suite of ab initio quantum chemistry programs

molecular properties.

comparisons, analysis of coverage, microdiversity, and linkage, and

dependent_to.name: py-numpy-quaternion
dependent_to.description:
This package creates a quaternion type in python, and further enables
numpy to create and manipulate arrays of quaternions. The usual
algebraic operations (addition and multiplication) are available, along
with numerous properties like norm and various types of distance
measures between two quaternions. There are also additional functions
like "squad" and "slerp" interpolation, and conversions to and from
axis-angle, matrix, and Euler-angle representations of rotations. The
core of the code is written in C for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-torchmeta
dependent_to.description:
A collection of extensions and data-loaders for few-shot learning &
meta-learning in PyTorch. Torchmeta contains popular meta-learning

DataLoader.

dependent_to.name: py-fury

includes algorithms that are useful but do not satisfy the scikit-learn
inclusion criteria, for instance due to their novelty or lower citation

programs in Python using a powerful and intuitive syntax. ProjectQ can
then translate these programs to any type of back-end, be it a simulator
run on a classical computer of an actual quantum chip.

dependent_to.name: getorganelle

dependent_to.name: py-qutip

dependent_to.name: py-spgl1
dependent_to.description:
SPGL1 is a solver for large-scale one-norm regularized least squares. It
is designed to solve any of the following three problems: Basis pursuit
denoise (BPDN): minimize ||x||_1 subject to ||Ax - b||_2 <= sigma, Basis
pursuit (BP): minimize ||x||_1 subject to Ax = b Lasso: minimize ||Ax -
b||_2 subject to ||x||_1 <= tau, The matrix A can be defined explicitly,
or as an operator that returns both both Ax and A'b. SPGL1 can solve
these three problems in both the real and complex domains.

dependent_to.name: py-accelerate
dependent_to.description:
A simple way to train and use PyTorch models with multi-GPU, TPU, mixed-
precision.

dependent_to.name: py-wordcloud

FLANN is a library for performing fast approximate nearest neighbor
searches in high dimensional spaces. It contains a collection of
algorithms we found to work best for nearest neighbor search and a
system for automatically choosing the best algorithm and optimum
parameters depending on the dataset. FLANN is written in C++ and
contains bindings for the following languages: C, MATLAB and Python.

dependent_to.name: py-retworkx
dependent_to.description: A high performance Python graph library implemented in Rust.

dependent_to.name: py-rustworkx

to be a replacement for qiskit's previous (and current) networkx usage
(hence the original name). The project was originally started to build a
faster directed graph to use as the underlying data structure for the
DAG at the center of qiskit-terra's transpiler. However, since it's
initial introduction the project has grown substantially and now covers
all applications that need to work with graphs which includes Qiskit.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools

dependent_to.name: py-hdbscan
dependent_to.description:
HDBSCAN - Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications
with Noise. Performs DBSCAN over varying epsilon values and integrates
the result to find a clustering that gives the best stability over
epsilon. This allows HDBSCAN to find clusters of varying densities
(unlike DBSCAN), and be more robust to parameter selection. In practice
this means that HDBSCAN returns a good clustering straight away with
little or no parameter tuning -- and the primary parameter, minimum
cluster size, is intuitive and easy to select. HDBSCAN is ideal for
exploratory data analysis; it's a fast and robust algorithm that you can
trust to return meaningful clusters (if there are any).

dependent_to.name: py-numexpr3

Numexpr3 is a fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy. With it,
expressions that operate on arrays (like "3*a+4*b") are accelerated and
use less memory than doing the same calculation in Python. In addition,
its multi-threaded capabilities can make use of all your cores, which
may accelerate computations, most specially if they are not memory-
bounded (e.g. those using transcendental functions). Compared to NumExpr
2.6, functions have been re-written in a fashion such that gcc can auto-
vectorize them with SIMD instruction sets such as SSE2 or AVX2, if your
processor supports them. Use of a newer version of gcc such as 5.4 is
strongly recommended.

dependent_to.name: py-numpy-groupies
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a couple of optimised tools for doing things
that can roughly be considered "group-indexing operations". The most
prominent tool is `aggregate`. `aggregate` takes an array of values, and
an array giving the group number for each of those values. It then
returns the sum (or mean, or std, or any, ...etc.) of the values in each
group. You have probably come across this idea before, using `matlab`
accumarray, `pandas` groupby, or generally MapReduce algorithms and
histograms. There are different implementations of `aggregate` provided,
based on plain `numpy`, `numba` and `weave`. Performance is a main
concern, and so far we comfortably beat similar implementations in other
packages (check the benchmarks).

intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, Uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-autograd
dependent_to.description:
Autograd can automatically differentiate native Python and Numpy code.
It can handle a large subset of Python's features, including loops, ifs,
recursion and closures, and it can even take derivatives of derivatives
of derivatives. It supports reverse-mode differentiation (a.k.a.
backpropagation), which means it can efficiently take gradients of
scalar-valued functions with respect to array-valued arguments, as well
as forward-mode differentiation, and the two can be composed
arbitrarily. The main intended application of Autograd is gradient-based
optimization. For more information, check out the tutorial and the
examples directory.

dependent_to.name: py-pybids
dependent_to.description: bids: interface with datasets conforming to BIDS

dependent_to.name: py-nestle
dependent_to.description: Nested sampling algorithms for evaluating Bayesian evidence.

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-rsatoolbox
dependent_to.description: Representational Similarity Analysis (RSA) in Python.

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: py-pydicom
dependent_to.description:
Pure python package for DICOM medical file reading and writing pydicom
is a pure Python package for working with DICOM files. It lets you read,
modify and write DICOM data in an easy "pythonic" way.

dependent_to.name: py-modin
dependent_to.description: Modin: Make your pandas code run faster by changing one line of code.

dependent_to.name: trinity
dependent_to.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.

dependent_to.name: py-networkx
dependent_to.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependent_to.name: py-ocnn
dependent_to.description:
O-CNN is an octree-based sparse convolutional neural network framework
for 3D deep learning.

dependent_to.name: py-pywavelets
dependent_to.description:
PyWavelets is a free Open Source library for wavelet transforms in
Python

dependent_to.name: py-gradio
dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models

dependent_to.name: py-chex
dependent_to.description: Chex is a library of utilities for helping to write reliable JAX code.

dependent_to.name: py-ahpy
dependent_to.description:
AHPy is an implementation of the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP), a
method used to structure, synthesize and evaluate the elements of a
decision problem.

dependent_to.name: py-quantities
dependent_to.description: Support for physical quantities with units, based on numpy

dependent_to.name: py-smartredis
dependent_to.description: A Python Interface for the SmartRedis Library Client

dependent_to.name: py-hpbandster
dependent_to.description:
A distributed Hyperband implementation with lots of room for
improvement

dependent_to.name: cmor
dependent_to.description:
Climate Model Output Rewriter is used to produce CF-compliant netCDF
files. The structure of the files created by the library and the
metadata they contain fulfill the requirements of many of the climate
community's standard model experiments.

dependent_to.name: py-nitransforms
dependent_to.description: NiTransforms -- Neuroimaging spatial transforms in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-igor
dependent_to.description: igor: interface for reading binary IGOR files.

dependent_to.name: py-mpi4jax
dependent_to.description:
Zero-copy MPI communication of JAX arrays, for turbo-charged HPC
applications in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-fisher
dependent_to.description: Fisher's Exact Test. Simple, fast implementation of Fisher's exact test.

dependent_to.name: py-copulas
dependent_to.description:
Copulas is a Python library for modeling multivariate distributions and
sampling from them using copula functions. Given a table containing
numerical data, we can use Copulas to learn the distribution and later
on generate new synthetic rows following the same statistical
properties.

dependent_to.name: py-lightning
dependent_to.description:
The Deep Learning framework to train, deploy, and ship AI products
Lightning fast.

dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-nature
dependent_to.description:
Qiskit Nature is an open-source framework which supports solving quantum
mechanical natural science problems using quantum computing algorithms

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-dolfinx
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to the next generation FEniCS problem solving
environment

dependent_to.name: py-merlin
dependent_to.description: Merlin Workflow for HPC.

dependent_to.name: py-torchmetrics
dependent_to.description: Machine learning metrics for distributed, scalable PyTorch applications.

dependent_to.name: py-arcgis
dependent_to.description: ArcGIS API for Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pandas-stubs
dependent_to.description:
These are public type stubs for pandas, following the convention of
providing stubs in a separate package, as specified in PEP 561. The
stubs cover the most typical use cases of pandas. In general, these
stubs are narrower than what is possibly allowed by pandas, but follow a
convention of suggesting best recommended practices for using pandas.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfr
dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: openimageio
dependent_to.description:
OpenImageIO is a library for reading and writing images, and a bunch of
related classes, utilities, and applications.

dependent_to.name: py-ci-sdr
dependent_to.description:
This repository contains an implementation for the Convolutive transfer
function Invariant Signal-to-Distortion Ratio objective for PyTorch as
described in the publication Convolutive Transfer Function Invariant SDR
training criteria for Multi-Channel Reverberant Speech Separation

dependent_to.name: py-psyclone
dependent_to.description:
Code generation for the PSyKAl framework from the GungHo project, as
used by the LFRic model at the UK Met Office.

dependent_to.name: py-neurolab
dependent_to.description: Simple and powerfull neural network library for python

dependent_to.name: py-pylops
dependent_to.description:
Many useful operators, however, do not lend themselves to an explicit
matrix representation when used to solve large-scale problems. PyLops
operators, on the other hand, still represent a matrix and can be
treated in a similar way, but do not rely on the explicit creation of a
dense (or sparse) matrix itself. Conversely, the forward and adjoint
operators are represented by small pieces of codes that mimic the effect
of the matrix on a vector or another matrix.

dependent_to.name: py-ont-fast5-api
dependent_to.description:
This project provides classes and utility functions for working with
read fast5 files. It provides an abstraction layer between the
underlying h5py library and the various concepts central to read fast5
files, such as "reads", "analyses", "analysis summaries", and "analysis
datasets". Ideally all interaction with a read fast5 file should be
possible via this API, without having to directly invoke the h5py
library.

dependent_to.name: py-pydoe
dependent_to.description:
The pyDOE package is designed to help the scientist, engineer,
statistician, etc., to construct appropriate experimental designs

dependent_to.name: py-colorpy
dependent_to.description:
ColorPy is a Python package to convert physical descriptions of light -
spectra of light intensity vs. wavelength - into RGB colors that can be
drawn on a computer screen. It provides a nice set of attractive plots
that you can make of such spectra, and some other color related
functions as well.

dependent_to.name: ascent
dependent_to.description:
Ascent is an open source many-core capable lightweight in situ
visualization and analysis infrastructure for multi-physics HPC
simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-jplephem
dependent_to.description:
This package can load and use a Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
ephemeris for predicting the position and velocity of a planet or other
Solar System body.

dependent_to.name: py-ipympl
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib Jupyter Extension.

dependent_to.name: py-osqp
dependent_to.description: OSQP: The Operator Splitting QP Solver

dependent_to.name: py-tables
dependent_to.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependent_to.name: py-pytecplot
dependent_to.description:
The pytecplot library is a high level API that connects your Python
script to the power of the Tecplot 360 visualization engine. It offers
line plotting, 2D and 3D surface plots in a variety of formats, and 3D
volumetric visualization. Familiarity with Tecplot 360 and the Tecplot
360 macro language is helpful, but not required.

dependent_to.name: py-dgl
dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.

dependent_to.name: octa
dependent_to.description: OCTA is an integrated simulation system for soft materials.

dependent_to.name: py-bx-python
dependent_to.description:
The bx-python project is a python library and associated set of scripts
to allow for rapid implementation of genome scale analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-probability
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.

dependent_to.name: fplo
dependent_to.description:
The FPLO(R) package is a full-potential local-orbital code to solve the
Kohn-Sham equations on a regular lattice or with free boundary
conditions (finite systems). Relativistic effects are treated either in
a scalar-relativistic or a full 4-component formalism. Available
functionals are LSDA, GGA (PBE 96) and LSDA/GGA+U. Orbital polarization
correction can be applied.

dependent_to.name: py-thinc
dependent_to.description: Thinc: Practical Machine Learning for NLP in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-blis
dependent_to.description:
Cython BLIS: Fast BLAS-like operations from Python and Cython, without
the tears

dependent_to.name: py-configspace
dependent_to.description:
Creation and manipulation of parameter configuration spaces for
automated algorithm configuration and hyperparameter tuning.

dependent_to.name: py-drep
dependent_to.description:
dRep is a python program for rapidly comparing large numbers of genomes.
dRep can also "de-replicate" a genome set by identifying groups of
highly similar genomes and choosing the best representative genome for
each genome set.

dependent_to.name: cantera
dependent_to.description:
Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems
involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes.

dependent_to.name: py-numba
dependent_to.description: NumPy aware dynamic Python compiler using LLVM

dependent_to.name: scine-utilities
dependent_to.description: Contains functionality which is used in most SCINE modules.

dependent_to.name: py-qsymm
dependent_to.description:
Qsymm is a symmetry finder and symmetric Hamiltonian generator. It
automatically generates model Hamiltonians from symmetry constraints and
finds the full symmetry group of your Hamiltonian.

dependent_to.name: py-toytree
dependent_to.description:
A minimalist tree manipulation and plotting library for use inside
jupyter notebooks. Toytree combines a popular tree data structure based
on the ete3 library with modern plotting tools based on the toyplot
plotting library.

dependent_to.name: py-biom-format
dependent_to.description:
The BIOM file format (canonically pronounced biome) is designed to be a
general-use format for representing biological sample by observation
contingency tables.

dependent_to.name: py-lightning-fabric
dependent_to.description:
Fabric is the fast and lightweight way to scale PyTorch models without
boilerplate.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-chainer
dependent_to.description:
Chainer is a Python-based deep learning framework aiming at
flexibility. It provides automatic differentiation APIs based on the
define-by-run approach (a.k.a. dynamic computational graphs) as well as
object-oriented high-level APIs to build and train neural networks. It
also supports CUDA/cuDNN using CuPy for high performance training and
inference.

dependent_to.name: py-yahmm
dependent_to.description: YAHMM is a HMM package for Python, implemented in Cython for speed.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfftw
dependent_to.description:
A pythonic wrapper around FFTW, the FFT library, presenting a unified
interface for all the supported transforms.

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-openpmd-validator
dependent_to.description:
Validator and Example Scripts for the openPMD markup. openPMD is an open
standard for particle-mesh data files.

dependent_to.name: py-jmp
dependent_to.description: JMP is a Mixed Precision library for JAX.

dependent_to.name: py-altair
dependent_to.description: Declarative statistical visualization library for Python

dependent_to.name: trilinos
dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependent_to.name: py-pyugrid
dependent_to.description: Work with triangular unstructured grids and the data on them.

dependent_to.name: py-seriate
dependent_to.description:
This is a Python implementation of Seriation algorithm. Seriation is an
approach for ordering elements in a set so that the sum of the
sequential pairwise distances is minimal. We state this task as a
Travelling Salesman Problem (TSP) and leverage the powerful Google's or-
tools to do heavy-lifting. Since TSP is NP-hard, it is not possible to
calculate the precise solution for a big number of elements. However,
the or-tools' heuristics work very well in practice, and they are used
in e.g. Google Maps.

dependent_to.name: py-bigdft
dependent_to.description:
BigDFT: the python interface of BigDFT for electronic structure
calculation based on Daubechies wavelets.

dependent_to.name: py-npx
dependent_to.description: Some useful extensions for NumPy

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-tensor-py3
dependent_to.description: A python module for multilinear algebra and tensor factorizations.

dependent_to.name: py-pyworld
dependent_to.description:
PyWorld wrappers WORLD, which is a free software for high-quality speech
analysis, manipulation and synthesis. It can estimate fundamental
frequency (F0), aperiodicity and spectral envelope and also generate the
speech like input speech with only estimated parameters.i

dependent_to.name: py-torchtext
dependent_to.description: Text utilities, models, transforms, and datasets for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-nc-time-axis
dependent_to.description: cftime support for matplotlib axis.

dependent_to.name: py-awkward
dependent_to.description: Manipulate JSON-like data with NumPy-like idioms.

dependent_to.name: py-efel
dependent_to.description:
The Electrophys Feature Extract Library (eFEL) allows neuroscientists to
automatically extract features from time series data recorded from
neurons (both in vitro and in silico). Examples are the action potential
width and amplitude in voltage traces recorded during whole-cell patch
clamp experiments. The user of the library provides a set of traces and
selects the features to be calculated. The library will then extract the
requested features and return the values to the user.

dependent_to.name: zfp
dependent_to.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-qdldl
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to the QDLDL free LDL factorization routine for quasi-
definite linear systems: Ax = b.

dependent_to.name: py-metaphlan
dependent_to.description:
MetaPhlAn is a computational tool for profiling the composition of
microbial communities (Bacteria, Archaea and Eukaryotes) from
metagenomic shotgun sequencing data (i.e. not 16S) with species-level.

dependent_to.name: py-espressopp
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research

dependent_to.name: py-sobol-seq
dependent_to.description: Sobol sequence implementation in python

dependent_to.name: yade
dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-cmocean
dependent_to.description: Colormaps for Oceanography.

dependent_to.name: py-lvis
dependent_to.description: Python API for LVIS dataset.

dependent_to.name: py-antspyx
dependent_to.description: Advanced Normalization Tools in Python.

dependent_to.name: openvdb
dependent_to.description: OpenVDB - a sparse volume data format.

dependent_to.name: py-scanpy
dependent_to.description:
Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression
data built jointly with anndata.

dependent_to.name: py-correctionlib
dependent_to.description: A generic correction library

dependent_to.name: py-spefile
dependent_to.description:
Reader for SPE files part of pyspec a set of python routines for data
analysis of x-ray scattering experiments

dependent_to.name: py-dalib
dependent_to.description:
Trans-Learn is a Transfer Learning library based on pure PyTorch with
high performance and friendly API.

dependent_to.name: py-mo-pack
dependent_to.description:
Packing methods used to encode and decode the data payloads of Met
Office Unified Model 'fields'

dependent_to.name: py-mrcfile
dependent_to.description:
Python implementation of the MRC2014 file format, which is used in
structural biology to store image and volume data.

dependent_to.name: py-deepsig
dependent_to.description:
deep-significance: Easy and Better Significance Testing for Deep Neural
Networks

dependent_to.name: py-pythran
dependent_to.description: Ahead of Time compiler for numeric kernels.

dependent_to.name: py-checkm-genome
dependent_to.description:
Assess the quality of microbial genomes recovered from isolates, single
cells, and metagenomes

dependent_to.name: py-weblogo
dependent_to.description:
WebLogo is a web based application designed to make the generation of
sequence logos as easy and painless as possible.

dependent_to.name: py-localcider
dependent_to.description: Tools for calculating sequence properties of disordered proteins

dependent_to.name: caffe
dependent_to.description:
Caffe is a deep learning framework made with expression, speed, and
modularity in mind. It is developed by the Berkeley Vision and Learning
Center (BVLC) and by community contributors.

dependent_to.name: openmm
dependent_to.description:
A high performance toolkit for molecular simulation. Use it as a
library, or as an application. We include extensive language bindings
for Python, C, C++, and even Fortran. The code is open source and
actively maintained on Github, licensed under MIT and LGPL. Part of the
Omnia suite of tools for predictive biomolecular simulation.

dependent_to.name: cosmomc
dependent_to.description:
CosmoMC is a Fortran 2008 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for
exploring cosmological parameter space, together with Fortran and python
code for analysing Monte-Carlo samples and importance sampling (plus a
suite of scripts for building grids of runs, plotting and presenting
results).

dependent_to.name: py-deepecho
dependent_to.description:
DeepEcho is a Synthetic Data Generation Python library for mixed-type,
multivariate time series.

dependent_to.name: py-pymol
dependent_to.description:
PyMOL is a Python-enhanced molecular graphics tool. It excels at 3D
visualization of proteins, small molecules, density, surfaces, and
trajectories. It also includes molecular editing, ray tracing, and
movies. Open Source PyMOL is free to everyone!

dependent_to.name: pygmo
dependent_to.description:
Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer (and its Python alter ego
PyGMO) is a C++ / Python platform to perform parallel computations of
optimisation tasks (global and local) via the asynchronous generalized
island model.

dependent_to.name: py-pyrosar
dependent_to.description: A framework for large-scale SAR satellite data processing

dependent_to.name: py-bidscoin
dependent_to.description:
Converts and organises raw MRI data-sets according to the Brain Imaging
Data Structure (BIDS).

dependent_to.name: py-alphafold
dependent_to.description:
AlphaFold is an AI system developed by DeepMind that predicts a
protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence. It regularly
achieves accuracy competitive with experiment.

dependent_to.name: py-python-javabridge
dependent_to.description:
The python-javabridge package makes it easy to start a Java virtual
machine (JVM) from Python and interact with it.

dependent_to.name: py-salib
dependent_to.description: Python implementations of commonly used sensitivity analysis methods.

dependent_to.name: py-pytools
dependent_to.description: A collection of tools for Python

dependent_to.name: py-ecos
dependent_to.description: This is the Python package for ECOS: Embedded Cone Solver.

dependent_to.name: xcfun
dependent_to.description: Exchange-Correlation functionals with arbitrary order derivatives.

dependent_to.name: py-dynim
dependent_to.description:
dynim is a pure-python package to perform dynamic-importance (DynIm)
sampling on a high-dimensional data set.

dependent_to.name: py-scine-chemoton
dependent_to.description: Software driving the automated exploration of chemical reaction networks

dependent_to.name: gdal
dependent_to.description:
GDAL: Geospatial Data Abstraction Library. GDAL is a translator library
for raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation.
As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single
vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported
formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities
for data translation and processing.

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
OpenMC is a community-developed Monte Carlo neutron and photon transport
simulation code. It is capable of performing fixed source, k-eigenvalue,
and subcritical multiplication calculations on models built using either
a constructive solid geometry or CAD representation. OpenMC supports
both continuous-energy and multigroup transport. The continuous-energy
particle interaction data is based on a native HDF5 format that can be
generated from ACE files produced by NJOY. Parallelism is enabled via a
hybrid MPI and OpenMP programming model.

dependent_to.name: py-lifelines
dependent_to.description:
Survival analysis was originally developed and applied heavily by the
actuarial and medical community. Its purpose was to answer *why do
events occur now versus later* under uncertainty (where *events* might
refer to deaths, disease remission, etc.). *lifelines* is a pure Python
implementation of the best parts of survival analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-brian
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks
